annotation: Tang Kristensen published this short description of local expressions along with BJK 3.22 above, despite its location in the manuscript.  "Langovrede træsko" were clogs with a long front worn primarily by men in contradistinction to women's "kortovrede træsko" with a short front, more in keeping with modern clogs. "Basarer" are also known as "nisse træsko". This type of clog turns up in a point at the front.
danish_manuscript:
De langovrede Tæsko kalder her sorte Træsko
og Basareren hvide Træsko.
english_manuscript: We call the langovrede clogs black clogs and the basarer white clogs.
danish_publication: Fra BJK 3.22: Dem langovrede træsko kalder vi her sorte træsko og basarerne hvide træsko.
english_publication: From BJK 3.22: Those langovrede clogs we call black clogs here and the basarer white clogs.
